alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 12:48PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated and minor flooding is expected, mainly in low-lying areas and along the Rocky River and its tributaries. Flooding along Back Creek south of Harrisburg may occur near the intersection of Robinson Church Road and Stallings Road, which is near Middleton and Rocky Meadows subdivisions. Pharr Mill Road may be submerged. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM EST, gauge reports indicated minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Even though Rocky River has crested, minor flooding will continue as runoff from the previous rainfall flows through the river system. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg and Mt Pleasant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
